p.s: Do you want to become an avid reader but do n't know how to enjoy a book ?
Do all the words make your head hurt ?
It 's time for you to start reading and enjoying it .

list.item:
Pick out a good book
that you are interested in reading .
If you like mystery , head over to the mystery section .
If you like fantasy , go to the fantasy section , etc.
Remember to read the back of the book to see if the plot looks interesting , and most importantly ,
do n't judge a book by it 's cover
.

item.s: Find a quiet or calming place .
This will help you become the character and focus more on the book .
When you find the calm place , make sure you have a comfortable spot , for this will help you relax .
Put yourself in the character 's shoes .
Focus on what they say .
What they hear , smell , see , feel , taste .
Once you put yourself where the character is , you will feel as if you are really there .
Understand .
Look up the meaning of all the words you do n't understand or have n't heard .
In case of classic literature , you could also look up some background for the story to put it into historical context .
This will allow you to see the book from the authors view and understand why they wrote that or why the story progressed the way it did .
Go deeper .
Think outside the box .
Maybe instead of what did happen , think about what would happen if the character did something different .
Allow yourself to enter your book and stretch all the possibilities and limits the author has set before you and make up your own events .
Take notes as you read .
This would allow you to think about what your read .
Take breaks from the book to help you picture things better .
When you take these breaks that they really help you see the book more clearly .
Enjoy the book .
Read the book slowly and calmly picking up as much information as you can in order to understand the book more .

Remember ,
reading is for enjoyment
.
It 's not a race so take your time .

list.item:
Go to your local library or book store for books
.
Ask for help if you do n't know what to get ; the people who work there will have great recommendations .
If you are n't a serious reader , I would suggest starting out at the library so you can return the book if you do n't like it .

item.s: It always helps to read books before you go to bed because it gives you something pleasant to dream about .
While you are reading your book , just find out the conclusion of that particular topic .
You do n't need to remember all the story .
Just find the conclusion by yourself and write down .

list.item:
Do not over-read
.
This could cause headaches and you would miss the thrill of guessing what 's next in the book .
